definition: beard/mustache or whiskers/facial hair/CL:撮[zuo3],根[gen1]/(coll.) bandit

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
careless/any-old-how, regardless of the specific task
pinyin: mei2 mao5 hu2 zi5 yi1 ba3 zhua1

definition: variant of 絡腮鬍子|络腮胡子[luo4 sai1 hu2 zi5]
lit. hair and beard all in one stroke/fig. to handle different things by the same method/one method to solve all problems/one size fits all
pinyin: tou2 fa5 hu2 zi5 yi1 ba3 zhua1

sentences.english: He stopped and chuckled as he tugged at his gray goatee .
sentences.chinese: 說到這裏他停了下來，捋着山羊鬍子格格地笑着。

sentences.english: He's had his beard shaved off.
It has saved my post-shave legs from irritation and allowed me to wear shorts all summer long.
sentences.chinese: 它救了我的後刮鬍子腿從刺激和允許我穿短褲夏天長。

sentences.english: He has a distinctive goatee, so I can recognize him easily.
sentences.chinese: 他留着獨特的山羊鬍子，所以我很容易就認出他來了。

sentences.english: Even the nails on the suits and the hair and beards of the soldiers are carefully detailed.
sentences.chinese: 那鎧甲上最小甲釘甚至武士俑的頭髮鬍子都絲絲可見。

sentences.english: He fixed his eyes on Wang Ho-fu's moustache in a vacant stare.
sentences.chinese: 他直瞪着眼睛，看定了王和甫嘴脣上的兩撇鬍子。

sentences.english: She disguised herself as a man by a false beard.
sentences.chinese: 她戴上假鬍子女扮男裝。

sentences.english: They are like junkies, with unkempt hair and beards, bad skin and poor appetites.
sentences.chinese: 跟毒癮者般，頭髮鬍子不修，皮膚蒼白，缺乏食慾。

sentences.english: I grew a heard during the trip, but I shaved it off when I came home.
sentences.chinese: 我旅行時留了鬍子，但我回到家時就把它颳了。

sentences.english: He has a white beard and wears a red suit.
sentences.chinese: 他留着白鬍子，穿一身紅衣服。

sentences.english: Mr. Hendrickson isn't in favor of mixing beards and business suits either.
sentences.chinese: 亨德里克森也不贊成留着鬍子而穿西裝。

sentences.english: Then I saw my prince, bearded and mustached.
sentences.chinese: 然後，我看見了我的留鬍子的王子。

sentences.english: By the way, I like your beard.
sentences.chinese: 順便說一句，我喜歡你的鬍子。

sentences.english: His father forced him to a clean shave.
sentences.chinese: 他被父親逼着剃光了鬍子。

sentences.english: John shaved off his beard with an electric razor.
sentences.chinese: 約翰以電動刮鬍刀颳去鬍子。

definition: plait/braid/pigtail/a mistake or shortcoming that may be exploited by an opponent/handle/CL:根[gen1],條|条[tiao2]
Mawei district of Fuzhou city 福州市[Fu2 zhou1 shi4], Fujian
ponytail (hairstyle)/horse's tail/slender fibers like horse's tail (applies to various plants)
